intro: Guettarda balansana, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, pendulous clusters of yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and birds, contributing to its ecological significance.
